page.title: 06DALRY(KIRK) POPULATION
page.content: In 1985 the Stewartry District Council estimated the population of Dalry parish to be 629.There are about a hundred young people under the age of 18. Few in the 18 to 40 age group move into the area ,but many move out to find work.There is a net influx of older age groups as Dalry is a popular choice with the active retired.There are still some families whose roots in the 'toun' go back for generations, but most have chosen to settle in Dalry within the last 50 years. In the nineteen thirties, the building of the Hydros brought workmen, and in the 1939_45 war troops and land girls were billeted in the area. Some married into the local population and settled here.The most recent incomers are professional and business people retiring from jobs in large cities and from abroad.
